description: This Kotlin source file defines a singleton object ServiceLocator that provides access to various repository implementations (both real network-based and mock versions) for content, metadata, assets, and ratings. It manages API instances, determines whether to use network or mock data based on feature flags and configuration, and logs data source usage.

classes.name: ServiceLocator
classes.description: A singleton object that provides access to various data repositories, managing whether to use real network implementations or mock versions based on feature flags and configuration.

methods.name: contentRepository
methods.description: Returns a ContentRepository instance, either network-based or mock, depending on configuration.

methods.name: metadataRepository
methods.description: Returns a MetadataRepository instance, either network-based or mock, depending on configuration.

methods.name: assetsRepository
methods.description: Returns an AssetsRepository instance, either network-based or mock, depending on configuration.

methods.name: ratingRepository
methods.description: Returns a RatingRepository instance, either network-based or mock, depending on configuration.

methods.name: useMocks
methods.description: Indicates whether the system is currently using mock data sources.

methods.name: shouldUseNetwork
methods.description: Determines if network data sources should be used based on feature flags and configuration.

methods.name: ensureApis
methods.description: Initializes API instances if they are not already created, based on configuration.

methods.name: logDataSourceOnce
methods.description: Logs the data source type once to avoid repeated logs.
